comments:
Driver: 4.2.1 candidate (4.2.1_200609071820A)
JRE: Sun 1.4.2_10 and IBM 1.4.2 SR3

Cannot import the exported symptom database into a new project using Symptom 0.1. An error message appears (IWAT0039E An exception occurred during the import) and the error log says that the XML is badly formed (the root element is missing). 
eclipse.buildId=M20060830-0800
java.version=1.4.2_10
java.vendor=Sun Microsystems Inc.

Command-line arguments:  -os win32 -ws win32 -arch x86 -data runtime-New_configuration3

I saw the a similar error when importing the symptom database into a new project using Symptom 2.0. In that case I was using the IBM J9 1.4.2 SR3 and the error log said, "premature end of file". With Symptom 2.0 this problem is intermittent (or perhaps the JRE makes a difference?)
eclipse.buildId=M20060830-0800
java.fullversion=J2RE 1.4.2 IBM J9 2.2 Windows 2000 x86-32 j9n142-20050929 (JIT enabled)

I imported the XML file into an application to validate its syntax. The application said that the XML file is well formed but that it had no grammar constraints.

Ruth, I tried all the combinations of import/export and I cannot reproduce your problem. I think you are using a wrong importer/format combination. I think we need to update the test case to make it more clear for testers.
When you're running a larger sdb import make sure you use -Xmx512m, this may be tcause of the premature end of file problem.
I had not increased to -Xmx512m. Could be that I misunderstood the test. I'll re-run this test once I've finished my last test suite for 4.2.1.
Ruth, have you rerun this testcase to confirm this is still a problem.  We need to determine if it is a code problem or a testcase problem.  Thanks.

I can reproduce the problem in 421C driver when I try to import a 2.0 symptom file using symptom v2.0 formatter but target to a symptom 1.0 target. This is an available import combination ie. v2.0 formatter to v1.0 target. I don't think this is a support conbimation. I see export symptom is blocked with error dialog when user try to export a v2.0 symptom from workspace to WebSphere v4 or v5 symptom format. I suppose similar dialog should be prompted for the import scenario, or simply block v1.0 target version when user select v2.0 import formatter.
However, I don't think this is blocking 421.

Not sure how I ran the test before but after increasing the memory to 1024m and being careful about the importer/format combination the symptom file imported without error. I was going to close this as INVALID until I saw Eugene's comment. I'll update the execution history to mark this test "inconclusive" and downgrade the severity to "minor".
This should be tested in 4.4 to see if it still exists. If it does not exist, please close it.  If it still exists, it should be fixed.  If the testcase is invalid it should be fixed or removed.
This testcase is working in 4.4.  It passed in iteration 1 and iteration 2.  Therefore I will close the defect.
